Aylen sat on Sarah's couch, tears streaming down her face as she told her best friend about the vivid nightmares and visions she had been experiencing. Sarah listened attentively, holding Aylen's hand and offering words of comfort and support.

"I know you're terrified, Aylen, but you have to trust me," Sarah said, her voice taking on a sinister undertone. "I'll always be here for you."

Aylen's heart skipped a beat as she looked up at Sarah and saw the smirk on her face. Suddenly, she realized that this was not her friend, but the thing that had been tormenting her in her dreams. She tried to stand up and run, but her legs wouldn't move.

"You're not alone, Aylen," Sarah said in a menacing tone. "I'm here with you."

Aylen's mind raced as she tried to understand what was happening. She couldn't believe that her best friend, the one person she had always trusted, was now a part of this nightmare.

"I understand why you're so afraid, Aylen," Sarah continued, her voice cold and calculating. "I see it all."

Aylen felt a surge of panic as she realized that this thing could control her mind, making her see and hear things that weren't real.

"Don't worry, Aylen," Sarah said, her voice now promising violence. "I'll make it all stop."

Aylen struggled against the invisible force holding her down, trying to find a way to escape.

"You know what you have to do, Aylen," Sarah said, her voice filled with a terrifying sense of understanding. "Don't you?"

Aylen closed her eyes and screamed, hoping that this would all be over soon. She woke up in her bed, drenched in sweat, her heart pounding in her chest. She lay there for a moment, trying to catch her breath and steady her racing mind. She knew now that she had to find a way to stop this thing once and for all, before it destroyed her completely.
What might the "you know what you have to do" quote imply?

The "you know what you have to do" quote implies that the thing tormenting Aylen is aware of her deepest fears and desires and is manipulating her into doing something she may not want to do. It could imply that Aylen has to make a difficult decision or take a drastic action in order for the torment to end. The quote could also imply that the thing is aware of something that Aylen is not and is trying to lead her to discover it. Overall, the quote creates a sense of manipulation and control, making Aylen question her own agency and decisions.
Let's try a vision, in broad daylight, where Aylen tries to confront this thing and it just torments her.

In the vision, Aylen is walking down a busy street when she sees the figure standing in front of her, its form constantly shifting between different people. It has a sinister smirk on its face as it taunts her, its voice changing to match whoever it is currently resembling.

"You can't escape me, Aylen," it says in a menacing tone. "I'm always here, always watching."

Aylen tries to confront it, but her words stumble out of her mouth as she tries to form a sentence. The thing's taunts become more cruel, it starts to mock her appearance, her abilities, her friends, her family, her life.

"You know what you have to do, Aylen. Don't you?" it says with a terrifying sense of understanding. "Just give in to me. Surrender your mind and body to me, and I'll make all the pain go away."

Aylen tries to protest, but her voice is barely audible over the thing's taunts. It starts to reach out its hand towards her, and she can feel the fear creeping over her as she realizes that it has the power to hurt her, even in the real world.

As Aylen tries to run, the thing lets out a sinister laugh and disappears, leaving Aylen standing alone in the middle of the crowded street, shaking and terrified.

Let's alter that vision slightly. Aylen tries to confront this thing and maybe even fight it, but she can't touch it and it seems amused by her attempts. It enjoys taunting her, saying "Over here!" and then vanishing, toying with her as she flails around trying to hit it.

In the vision, Aylen sees the figure standing in front of her, taking on the form of a random person from the street. She feels a surge of anger and determination as she charges towards it, her fists clenched. But as soon as she tries to make contact, her hands pass through the figure as if it were a mirage. The figure laughs and taunts her, "Over here!" as it suddenly appears behind her, still out of reach. Aylen turns around and tries again, but the figure disappears and reappears in different locations, always just out of reach. The figure's taunts become increasingly cruel, "Come on Aylen, is that all you've got?", "You're never going to catch me, Aylen." Aylen grows more and more desperate, her attempts to hit the figure becoming increasingly wild and futile. The figure seems to be relishing in her frustration and helplessness, until the vision ends and Aylen wakes up feeling defeated and humiliated.
Let's try a version with some dialogue between Aylen and that thing.

Aylen stood in the park, her heart pounding as she searched for the figure. She could feel its presence, could sense it watching her. Suddenly, it appeared, taking on the form of a person she had once trusted. "You can't run from me, Aylen," it taunted, its voice low and menacing.

Aylen clenched her fists, determined to face this thing head-on. "What do you want from me?" she shouted.

The figure grinned, its eyes glinting with malice. "Want? I don't want anything from you, Aylen. I just enjoy watching you suffer."

Aylen lunged at it, but her hands passed through its form as if it were made of smoke. The figure laughed, darting away and reappearing a few feet away. "You can't touch me, Aylen. I am beyond your reach."

Aylen turned in circles, trying to keep the figure in her sight. "Why are you doing this to me?" she cried.

The figure shrugged, its form shifting to that of another person Aylen had known. "Why not? You're weak, Aylen. Easy to manipulate and control. It's so entertaining."

Aylen felt tears of frustration prick at her eyes. "Please, just leave me alone," she begged.

The figure's grin widened. "Never, Aylen. I'll be with you always. Watching, waiting, enjoying your pain." And with that, it vanished, leaving Aylen alone in the park, trembling with fear and anger.
Aylen confronts the thing, asking why it's going to destroy the world and why is it making her watch.

Aylen stood in the middle of a deserted street, her heart pounding in her chest. She could see the figure standing a few feet away, its form shifting and twisting as if it were made of smoke.

"Why are you doing this?" Aylen shouted, her voice trembling with anger and fear. "Why are you showing me all of these terrible things? Why are you trying to destroy the world?"

The figure let out a cold, mocking laugh. "Why not?" it said, its voice echoing through the empty streets. "It's so much fun to watch the world burn, to see the fear and suffering on the faces of the mortals. And as for you, Aylen, you're just a convenient tool. Someone to show me the way."

Aylen clenched her fists, her frustration and anger boiling over. "I won't be used by you!" she screamed, lunging forward to try and strike the figure. But her fists passed right through it, as if it were made of smoke.

The figure chuckled, its form shifting again. "You can't touch me, Aylen," it said. "I'm beyond your reach. But don't worry, I'll be with you every step of the way, tormenting you and showing you all the horrors to come."

Aylen felt a wave of despair wash over her as the figure disappeared, leaving her alone in the empty street. She knew that it was right, that she was trapped and there was nothing she could do to stop it.

Aylen develops a test to ensure she's actually in the real world (kind of like in Inception) and the next time she tries to confide in Sarah, she does that test first to confirm this is reality. It works, and she pours her heart out to her friend.

Aylen carefully explains her situation to Sarah, including the test she's developed to ensure she's in reality. Sarah listens attentively, nodding along as Aylen speaks. Aylen finishes by saying, "I know it sounds crazy, but I need to be sure. I need to know that this is real and that I'm not being tormented in my dreams again."
Sarah reassures her, "I understand. I'm here for you, Aylen. Let's do the test together." Together, they perform the test and Aylen finally feels a sense of relief wash over her when it confirms that they are indeed in the real world. She begins to open up to Sarah about her deepest fears and the things she's seen in her visions. Sarah listens patiently, offering words of comfort and support. She tells Aylen that she believes her and that they will figure out a way to stop this thing from destroying the world. Aylen feels a weight lifted off her shoulders, knowing that she has a trusted ally in her fight against this powerful and terrifying entity.
